title: Retry failed build/deploy and verify live RICHUAL site

requirements.text: Retry the previously failed build/update so the project builds successfully without the prior AI service error, and publish the updated version of the existing RICHUAL site.
acceptanceCriteria: A full build completes successfully (no AI service error during the build/update).
The updated version is published and accessible as a live site.

requirements.text: After the successful rebuild/redeploy, perform a smoke test of all existing routes to confirm there are no regressions: /, /about, /programs, /membership, /ritual-philosophy, /apply, and /admin/applications.
acceptanceCriteria: Each listed route loads without runtime errors in the browser.
Navigation from the header works for all public pages and the Apply CTA routes to /apply.
The admin page remains not linked from the public navigation.

requirements.text: Verify the end-to-end application submission and admin review flows still function after the rebuild: submitting an application from the Apply page persists it in the backend, and an authenticated admin can view submissions (most recent first) on /admin/applications while non-admins are blocked.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the Apply form results in a success confirmation state in the UI.
A new submission is persisted and appears in the admin applications list.
Applications are displayed most-recent-first on the admin page.
Non-admin users cannot access the applications list (access is restricted).

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor with all logic in backend/main.mo; only add backend/migration.mo if an actual state upgrade is required.
Do not edit files under frontend/src/components/ui or any other paths listed in frontend.immutablePaths; compose existing components instead.
Use English for any user-facing text introduced or modified by this build.
nonGoals: Adding new marketing pages or changing the siteâ€™s information architecture.
Introducing third-party authentication providers (only Internet Identity is supported).
Adding external databases or non-Motoko backend services.
